terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through the internet rather than installed locally
Minimum Viable Product - a basic version of a product with core features that allows testing with real users and gathering feedback before full development
Written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand a software product, including user guides, API references, and technical specifications
The ability of a software system to handle increased workload or user demand by adding resources without compromising performance
The delivery of computing services including servers, storage, and software over the internet rather than using local hardware
Predictable income generated from customers who pay regularly (monthly or yearly) for continued access to a service or product
The specific group of users or customers that a product or service is designed to serve and appeal to
Specific problems, frustrations, or challenges that users experience which a product or service aims to solve
Information and opinions provided by users about their experience with a product, used to guide improvements and development decisions
The practice of contracting external companies or developers to handle specific business functions like software development instead of doing it in-house
Outsourcing software development to companies in nearby countries or similar time zones to reduce costs while maintaining easier communication
Formal requests for help or problem resolution submitted by users to a company's customer support system
The overall experience and satisfaction a person has when interacting with a product, website, or application
The process of gathering and analyzing information about target customers, competitors, and market conditions to make informed business decisions
An early working model or sample of a product used to test concepts and functionality before full-scale development
